arts.ttl: Gazzetta: AC Milan players ratings in 1-1 draw vs Atalanta
arts.sum: Last night in Bergamo, AC Milan's Massimiliano Allegri were unable to get the three full points in matchday 9 of Serie A against Atalanta. The match ended in a 1-1 result, and the Italian newspaper La Gazzetta dello Sport, in this morning's print edition, shared their usual ratings. Who was the best Milan player against Atalanta? […]

arts.ttl: Milan slow down vs Atalanta – Ricci’s goal not enough for Allegri
arts.sum: Atalanta has made draws a constant companion this season. This was their seventh in nine matches, the fifth in a row in Serie A. They always leave with a sense of something unfinished. Milan, on the other hand, had to accept this outcome for the third time in their last four games. Their recent results […]

arts.ttl: Atalanta 1 – Milan 1 | Allegri’s press conference: “We must concede fewer goals”
arts.sum: Massimiliano Allegri, AC Milan’s coach, spoke at the press conference after Atalanta-Milan: Did you expect this match tonight? "We made some technical errors, partly due to fatigue and partly due to Atalanta’s strength. This led to a first half below our level where we conceded an avoidable goal. In the second half we improved a […]

arts.ttl: Atalanta 1 – Milan 1 | Gabbia to MTV: “We want to keep improving”
arts.sum: After the match against Atalanta, Matteo Gabbia spoke to Milan TV: "We always want to improve. Today in the first half we made a few too many technical mistakes, then in the second half we improved. We need to be clear-headed when analyzing the match, we must keep working and prepare as best as possible […]

arts.ttl: Juric: ‘Atalanta dominated AC Milan, had triple the intensity levels’
arts.sum: Ivan Juric believes Atalanta ‘had triple the intensity of Milan and dominated throughout,’ so were...

arts.ttl: Allegri positive after Atalanta draw despite possible injuries for Leao and Gimenez
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher Massimiliano Allegri has confirmed a couple more potential injury worries for AC Milan, praising the team for their performance against Atalanta. For the second game in a row Milan took the lead after just a few minutes, and for the second game in a row they were unable to turn it into three points. This […] The post Allegri positive after Atalanta draw despite possible injuries for Leao and Gimenez appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: Atalanta 1 – Milan 1 | Allegri: “Leao had a hip issue… Loftus-Cheek? 20 extraordinary minutes”
arts.sum: Massimiliano Allegri spoke to DAZN after Atalanta-Milan ended 1-1. His statements: Was this the toughest night of the year? “It’s a period with a few injuries, but the team is reacting well. In the first half we had to defend because we made too many technical errors when building from the back. We had the […]

arts.ttl: Atalanta 1 – Milan 1 | Gabbia: “Today’s draw leaves a bitter taste”
arts.sum: Matteo Gabbia spoke to DAZN after Atalanta vs Milan ended 1-1. His words: A feedback on the match? "Honestly, we need to analyze the whole evening. We said it in the dressing room, in the first half we should have done better technically in building up play. The number of technical errors was too high […]

arts.ttl: Player Ratings: Atalanta 1-1 AC Milan – Ricci relief but Gimenez worry grows
arts.sum: By: Isak Möller AC Milan failed to bounce back from the draw against Pisa, clinching just one point against Atalanta this evening. Several players failed to impress and below are the ratings for the Rossoneri. If you haven’t already, make sure to check out how we decide the player ratings. From the scale to what affects the rating, we […] The post Player Ratings: Atalanta 1-1 AC Milan – Ricci relief but Gimenez worry grows appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: Atalanta 1 – Milan 1 | The Rossoneri held in Bergamo, Lookman cancels out Ricci’s early goal
arts.sum: The report of Atalanta vs Milan, which ended 1-1 at the New Balance Arena in Bergamo, does not allow the Rossoneri to temporarily overtake Roma. First half of Atalanta - Milan: This time it takes less than one half to see a repeat of what happened in Milan-Pisa, though the opponent is of higher quality. […]
